intro: Limnophila aquatica, commonly known as water thyme, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. It thrives in moist to aquatic environments, often found in marshes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. Limnophila aquatica is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
